title: Socio-Legal Hybrid Learning Course for Strengthening Forensic and Law Enforcement Practitioners' Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge of forensic science theory, law enforcement procedures, social systems, and conflict resolution, along with practical experience required
context.additional_context: Combines smartphone-based mobile learning platforms with weekly on-site workshops, focusing on cultivating practical skills and social problem-solving abilities through real-case analysis. Emphasizes community stakeholder analysis and evidence evaluation methods considering cultural contexts

learning_goals: Learners can systematically explain crime scene evidence collection and preservation procedures according to legal and scientific standards
Scientific analysis methods can be applied to evaluate the legal validity and societal impact of evidence.

Learners, working in teams of 4–5 members, perform real-case simulations (e.g., community conflict resolution cases) and submit project outcomes achieving at least 3 out of 5 points in each of the four collaborative competency rubric items: communication, role distribution, problem-solving, and result derivation. This enables the formulation of civic rights and institutional improvement strategies.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
